intro: Diplazium okinawaense, commonly known as the Okinawa spleenwort, is a species of fern native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered fronds that often grow on rock surfaces or tree trunks. The plant has a unique growth habit, with the sporophyte typically developing from the base of the gametophyte. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a distinct, serrated margin. Diplazium okinawaense is often found in shaded, humid environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
